Reviews.Title: “Good location, pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: SatsKerava_Finland
Reviews.Content: We had lovely 4 days in Rome staying in Resideza Santa Maria. Perfect location and comfortable clean rooms. Staff was very friendly and helpfull. Our room was bit dark (hence the hotel is built in old monastery) but did not really matter as we never were in during the days as we had long days discovering the wonders of Rome. Neighgbourhood is full of nice atmospheric restaurants and bars catering for all the tastes and budgets. I would defenetly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay in one of the best locations in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Bruin91302
Reviews.Content: Our daughter had been studying in Rome for 5 months, and the rest of our family went to visit her. We choose Residenzia Santa Maria because it was a short walk to her school, although I was a little concerned about the location. It was very much the opposite. After seeing the rest of Rome, this was by far my favorite location! It was not nearly as crowded with tourists and crowds. The restaurants in easy walking distance were better and cheaper than the ones near the big attractions. (OMG - the food in Rome is amazing!) It was only a 15-20 minute casual walk to all the big sites. The rooms were very clean and comfortable, but basic. For the three of us, we had a triple with a king and a twin bed, and that was about it in the room. The breakfasts were good.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay in Great Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: jerrica27
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 days in Rome. Wanted to stay in Trastevere and picked this hotel based on reviews here. Got here fairly easily from the airport, took the F1 train to Trastverse, then it was a quick tram ride to the hotel. Make sure you buy and validate tickets for the tram and trains. Don't always check but when they do you can get a huge fine. Were greeted by helpful staff right away, gave us a map and pointed out all the main attractions. You can walk to all the major sights from here, nothing is more than 25 mins away, we walked everywhere.Breakfast was ok. You can go to the nearby Hotel Santa Maria between 5-7 for wine and snacks. We did that one night, it was a good way to start the evening and we got a good dinner recommendation that way. Really enjoyed the neighborhood, Lots of things to do and restaurants and had a nice neighborhood fell. Wifi didn't really work in our room, but was fine in lobby, it was the only place in Italy we stayed in that had free wifi so that was a big plus. Room was nice, and loved the high powered showerhead. Offered a discount if we paid cash but did not want to use up all our euros so we paid with a card. Staff very friendly, was usually unattended after 7 but you could call hotel if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect perch in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: tmac793
Reviews.Content: We were a middle-aged couple staying at Residenze Santa Maria for 8 nights in March-April 2012. It was our first time there and it met and exceeded expectations: very clean, comfortable, and tastefully decorated. An extra plus was that it was also a nice quiet place, yet well-located within Trastevere. The staff, especially Giovanna and Hussein, were wonderful. They were very helpful and were also very responsive to e-mails we sent before we arrived. Breakfast was ample and delicious. We would definitely stay there again and highly recommend it. One thing travelers to Trastevere should look out for is possible trouble at the Trastevere train station. We took the local train from Fiumicino Airport to Trastevere. That worked fine, but we were sprayed with some sort of brown liquid by a couple of guys there who claimed it was bird droppings. We believe they meant to distract us so that they could steal from us -- or something! So look out for that and consider taking a taxi or private car from the airport instead. On our return to the airport, Giovanna arranged for a car for us and that worked very well.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy small hotel in the only neighbourhood you really need in Rome”
Reviews.Author: FamiljenGalen
Reviews.Content: This is a gem! Small, personal hotel. Nice breakfast, great cappuccinis! Big enough rooms, beams and stone walls. Not many english speaking tv-channels, but you would have much else to do in Trastevere:) Apart from all sights and high end shopping, Trastevere offers all you need for a weekend in Rome. And by choosing this hotel you are close by just about everything.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ann z
Reviews.Content: I was worried about travelling to Rome as a single. Santa Maria Residence was the perfect place and great location. Staff very friendly and very professional. Got great tips and lots of advice as to where to go and what to see. Breakfast was great, good cappucino and lots of things to choose from. I would advise this residence to people travelling and even if you are on your own. Ann

Reviews.Title: “Basic & Clean but some problems”
Reviews.Author: chufa
Reviews.Content: Location: It is located in a lively, touristic area. There're lots of cafe's and restaurants close by catering to tourists. Room: There're 6 rooms all on the ground floor. There is no direct sunlight into the rooms thus a bit damp and cold. It is clean and neat. Decoration is classical modern with a country flair. Size of the room is not big but comfortable. Our room has a small problem with dripping water of the toilet bowl continuing all night and day. It's wasteful of water and annoying to hear the water dripping noise. Although the room is clean, the extra blanket in the closet is very dirty and dusty. We had to use it anyway because of the cold weather. Breakfast: We're not impressed by the breakfast. The breakfast room is small & cozy situated in the basement with 6 tables, a buffet table and coffee bar. It's a simple buffet with a varieties of dry cakes, 1 kind of bread (very dry), some scramble eggs, 1 kind of cheese, salami and ham, juices are not fresh, yogurt and some fruit. Our cappucino was a bit cold. Internet: Poor WIFI connection in the room. Staff: Friendly and helpful. Comment: We booked online directly from the hotel website. The hotel offered us a discounted room rate on an advance payment and no cancellation. The hotel website stated the payment would be charged within 24 hours of the online booking. When we checked out, the reception asked us to pay cash because they said the hotel didn't charge our credit card. Anyway we let them charge again the same credit card and hope this is not a double payment. We were confused by this. Caution: From Fiumicino airport we encountered many taxi scams. Please note the flat rate taxi from airport to city center is 40 euro. Please don't let them scam you!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel -a hone away from home!”
Reviews.Author: LYNSEY A
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel. From the moment we arrived the service was outstanding. We arrived early but werestill able to check in to our room. The room 5 was lovely, very cost, quiet and everything we needed. Breakfast was lovely and especially the cappuccinos which were made by such a friendly lady. The location of the hotel is just perfect to see all of the sights and close to some of the best restaurants around. We can highly recommend this hotel to everyone, perfect! Thank you so much Residenza Santa Maria.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, also for families, and good buffet breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: JD_NL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residenza Santa Maria on our first holiday as a family. Our room was spacious, it was a room facing the street but it was a quiet street. Only on Saturday night some noise from a nearby disco (each time they opened the door we could hear the music). Not very loud though. It is a lively neighborhood and that`s also why we wanted to stay here. It`s so convenient to stay in this neighborhood and be close to so many nice restaurants, galleries and shops. Small minus points: shower drain a bit clogged, no central heating so air conditioning system is used for heating, and found long black hair in bed that definitely did not belong to us. Would stay again though, everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, comfortable and Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: alexander d
Reviews.Content: Nestled away in Rome's most lively and authentic area, Trastevere, lies the Residenza Santa Maria, A little gem that has everything you would hope for in a Hotel. With only six rooms, the dedication to customer service, made us feel like we are staying with friends. Literally a 2min walk from a treasure of great local restaurants, a Piazza that boasts incredible Ice cream (or cappucuino in the morning) and bustling locals enjoying a stroll, it was a home away from home. Coming back to our room was a pleasure, with a small warm living room, furnished with ancient roman reliefs, books and various guides to Rome, which we enjoyed immensely, a small courtyard with alfrescos (perfect to sneak a cigar whilst the wife slept) and a downstairs bar that is stylish and comfortable. The highlight was Stefano, the owner, who bent over backwards to ensure our stay was nothing short of perfect. A charming italian, who showed where to eat the most delicious bowl of pasta ever, booked tours for us to see the best sights and really made us fall in love with Rome. The residenza was the start of a love affair with Rome and now that we moved here, we still pass by every so often to enjoy a glass of wine. A true standard of what travelling should be like.

Reviews.Title: “Great part of Rome to stay in”
Reviews.Author: Anna_M_Ch
Reviews.Content: Really pleased that we chose to stay in Trastevere - excellent area to spend the evenings in, lots of restaurants to choose from - early evening drinks in the Piazza Santa Maria. Enjoyed our stay in the Residenza - pleasant, helpful staff. Good breakfasts. Our rooms were very quiet(Rooms 4 & 5) - but think those with windows onto inner courtyard could be noisy in summer since guests probably sit out there till late. Showers good though not as much hot water as we would have liked (toilet flush a bit temperamental!). Liked the fact that there is very little traffic in this part of Trastevere. Would definitely recommend the area and the Residenza.

Reviews.Title: “Lonely Step Sister to Hotel Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: CBC522
Reviews.Content: The Trastevere neighborhood is a perfect fun location to stay. The hotel is at the centers heart and close to all it has to offer. Unfortunately the hotel itself is uninviting and cold. The rooms were not clean, sheets were only changed twice during my seven day stay, the bathroom had mold, the top of the bed were covered in dust and the floors were dirty. There is no Wi Fi in the rooms. The rooms are very claustrophobic at best. Most of what is offered for the morning breakfast is stale and a few mornings the eggs offered were cold. The women who is at the front desk every morning is rude and unfriendly. The hotel itself is very isolated. Aside from the rude front desk attendant, there is absolutely no one in the hotel during the day or evening to help you with anything or to make you feel welcomed. The reception area is only attended during check in and check out. The highlight of the hotel is the sweet nice young man who helped us during our late arrival and during the evening refreshments at Hotel Santa Maria. He is friendly, lively, kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: BobR3
Reviews.Content: Residenza is a small, reasonably priced boutique hotel. Rooms r very comfortable, breakfast is large & v. good. Unlike other hotels there is no charge for internet / wifi. Trastevre is a wonderful area in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Simply wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: TwoPugs
Reviews.Content: As previous reviewers have said, a great, intimate hotel in the heart of the atmosphere-laden Trastevere district, with a huge choice of restaurants on hand. We had a spacious superior double room with a very comfortable bed, and insulation from any outside noises.The one of us with a definite sweet tooth thoroughly enjoyed the breakfasts, but the other less so. But we both agree that the standard of service was outstanding. Three people stand out: the charming and cheerful Giampiero, who greeted us when we arrived at the hotel after midnight, and serves as bartender at the sister establishment Hotel Santa Maria a couple of minutes' away, where each evening he prepares snacks for a complimentary buffet (to which Residenza residents are also invited). Then there is Giovanna, who works at the Residenza reception desk: when we had missed our flight to Rome, on her own initiative she called us at home in Sweden to provide us with information about transportation from Milan. Finally, when the Residenza reception was closed in the evenings, Orchidea on the reception at Hotel San Maria did searches to provide us with a wealth of information that we requested. Brief summary: charming hotel in great location with outstanding staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully attentive staff, great breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: June H
Reviews.Content: A very intimate and private place to stay, well located in the heart of Trastevere. The staff were friendly, attentive and extremely helpful, keeping the front desk open to meet us late at night after our flight into Rome was delayed. Breakfast is not to be missed - a good selection of the usual continental fare, but make sure you leave a lot of room for the locally made pastries and cakes. Top it off with fresh coffee - the young lady working there is a very accomplished barista, and will cheerfully make you superb espressos and capuchinos upon request.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in the heart of Trastevere!”
Reviews.Author: AMRSA
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel! It only has 6 rooms so it has the feel of a B&B but the privacy and amenitites of a hotel. I first stayed here in September 2010 and recently returned for my 2nd stay this month...both times spending 6 nights at the hotel. The staff (of which there are only about 5 or 6 people) are very nice and accommodating. I stayed in the same room during both of my stays, so I can't speak for the other rooms, but mine (#5) was a decent size and clean. I typically like to stay in modern/trendy hotels, and this is definitely not that with its slightly outdated and old-fashioned decor....but what it lacks in style it makes up for with its charm, staff and location! The location is great...tucked away on a small street in Trastevere, just off of Piazza Santa Maria. It's a very short walk to the river, and the #8 tram is just a few minutes away as well. There are a ton of cafes and restaurants on all the surrounding streets. I already liked this hotel after last year's stay, but one little thing that added to this year's visit was when I arrived to check in, the receptionist greeted me and commented on the fact that I had cut my hair, as she remembered it being longer a year ago when I last stayed there! For me, it's personal touches like this that will keep me coming back to Residenza Santa Maria.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet getaway”
Reviews.Author: KPeyo
Reviews.Content: Residenza Santa Maria was great. The room was large enough for our family. Not typical of European size hotel rooms. The area looked sketchy but turned out to be amazing. The area food was the best!!!! Really neat old Italy feel with cobble streets and locals walking around at night. Gratsi Residenza Santa Maria Kerri P (CA)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a lovely area of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Walkers-Wombourne
Reviews.Content: Picked the Residenza Santa Maria primarily as it was on the train route from Fiumincino airport to the port of Civitaveccia where we were picking up a cruise. The Residenza Santa Maria is a great hotel - small, quaint, well presented & full of charachter in a great location. The hotel is easily accessible by public transport - we caught the train from the airport to Trastevere station,the tram down the road from which the hotel was a short 5 min walk. It is situated in a lovely area of Rome - cobbled streets full of reasonably priced bars & restaurants - so much cheaper & better than other more touristy areas of Rome. Trastevere is also within easy walking distance to all the main sites - St Peters was only a 20 mins walk, Trevi fountain 25 mins the other way etc. Breakfast was fine - it was continental sytle & typical of Rome but at least what was served was fresh & more than adequate - great coffee. Hotel staff were extremely helpful & even offered to arrange taxi transfers to & from the airport. Would fully recommend staying at The Residenza Santa Maria.

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome and a quiet sleep in middle of Roma”
Reviews.Author: ConnieNetherlands
Reviews.Content: When you want to stay in the middle of Roma and appreciate a good sleep & a warm welzome: this is the place to be! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “best accommodation in Rome ever”
Reviews.Author: 188057Charlie
Reviews.Content: i have nothing to say except that i have stay in many hotels in Rome and this is the only hotel you can sleep in the morning with out being walk up from doors or breakfast preparation Here breakfast is the best , staff the best , except night receptionist which very rude and beds should have better mattresses Its grate using the bikes they offer for free going around Rome

Reviews.Title: “Appreciated their kindness”
Reviews.Author: Kahala4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very comfortable from the minute you walk in. Husseen greeted us and then never stopped taking care of us. He gave us tips we didn't know we needed and genuinely cared that we had everything we needed throughout our stay. The hotel has a family room to hang out in and an easy feelilng to it. We needed a room to accomodate four so we had bunk beds for the kids which were great. Everything worked, including the airconditioning. Just remember that it is located in the Trastevere section as opposed to the heart of Rome so you're not walking distance to key attractions. We preferred being away from the hecticness and liked the charm of the nearby plaza where we ate dinner most nights so Trastevere worked for us. We did have an unfortunate family emergency while there and do want to note how incredibly kind they were to us and how helpful. They went above and beyond what we ever expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Familyoffour01_11
Reviews.Content: This is nice, small, personal hotel. The rooms are nicely decorated and very clean - very friendly and helpful staff. Reseasonably priced minibar and laundry service. Room was a good size and v comfortable for a family of four. But for us it all came down to location, location, location! Trastevere is the perfect place to come back to and wind down after a day of exploring Rome. The place is packed with good resturants and its a great place to stroll around at night. For the sights in Rome, we found almost everything close and within walking distance, and for slightly further field trips taxis are reasonably priced. Downish sides - saw someone mention that rooms are dark - ours was quite dark, but I think most rooms probably are in Rome (small windows) , also as someone also mentioned - on a couple of occasions the water was starting to get a bit colder on the fourth shower. Breakfast was simple but tasty, maybe could have ahad abit more fresh fruit. Overall we thought that the Res Santa Maria was a great choice, we booked direct with the hotel by e-mail and thought this was a good option, both financially and for logistics (they sorted us out with transport from airport etc.).

Reviews.Title: “Great area, basic accommodation”
Reviews.Author: VandAOZ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. It is located in the Trastavere area of Rome which is full of great restaurants and has a wonderful ambience and is in walking distance of many of the great sites of Rome. On arrival we found that our room had not been cleaned adequately; this was rectified after we complained. The breakfast was very basic and could be improved significantly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location & staff but easy improvements should be made.”
Reviews.Author: GerSher017
Reviews.Content: Stepping out each day into Trastevere was a thrill, the cobblestone streets, the activity, the restaurants, bars and sights within easy walking distanced. And the staff couldn't have been more obliging. Because it was a monastery it's naturally dark. But THIS dark! More light inside would make it possible to read more easily. Also, we were not told until arrival that there would be no one at the desk after 10 pm and in case of emergency, we were to walk the couple of blocks to Hotel Santa Maria. In checking this out, we found access there wasn't easy. A simple 24-hour phone connection would be a good idea. Might also suggest that breakfasts could be made more interesting by using fruits of the season.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastica! Can't wait to return.”
Reviews.Author: 22Raffles
Reviews.Content: Giovanna is fantastica! She is a gracious and wonderful hostess, and made our stay, in all ways, the warmest Rome experience possible. Grazie. The Residenza can't be more ideally located with a charming atmosphere during the day but at night time, the little lanes come alive.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Airmay
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Residenza Santa Maria while visiting Rome for my first time. I chose this hotel based on its location and otherwise positive reviews, and I was not disappointed. The neighborhood really is a charmer. A great location to explore Rome. The hotel itself is modest, my room was roomy, with a window looking onto the interior courtyard, so there wasn't a lot of 'privacy', but that was not a big issue for me. The breakfast was pretty basic, but nice and sufficient to get you through the day. There is a computer in the lobby to keep up on e-mail, but otherwise this property is free of frills. I never bothered to check out the cocktail hour at the other property, I knew it existed based on other reviews, but the staff never mentioned it, and it just seemed a bit awkward, so I didn't pursue it. Overall, the neighborhood is the star, the hotel is basic - but cozy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Average”
Reviews.Author: iloveitaly1010
Reviews.Content: This was a nice but average hotel. The staff was very helpful but the rooms were just mediocre. The breakfast was not as good as many others I have had in Italy. I thought for the price the value was just okay.

Reviews.Title: “A warm welcome and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Rosebrook_10
Reviews.Content: Residenz Santa Maria was a delight, Staff were friendly, welcoming and helpful. Giovanna is especially charming! Their restaurant recommendations were very welcome and rewarding. A very generous breakfast included in room price. My room was large and had a gorgeous deep bath. The interior courtyard tranquil and a pleasant place to sit and read or recover from a hectic day out on the cobblestones. Well located in relation to bars, resturants and public transport. .

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Murls
Reviews.Content: Loved this hidden gem. Breakfast was great, the neighborhood is full of fun places to eat and drink.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Return, Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: NZele
Reviews.Content: The Residenza Santa Maria was a wonderful place to stay. This was our first time in Rome and after reading the wonderful reviews, we decided to stay in the Trastevere neighborhood. I am so glad that we made the right decision. I was very surprised at the size of our room and bathroom - it even came equipped with a rain shower. The exposed beamed ceilings and exposed brick walls added to the charm, definatley and old world feeling. The included breakfast was wonderful with great local products and the best coffee we had ever tasted. The neighborhood is the best of all of Rome, it is not overly crowded and doesn't feel touristy. The are several restaurants and great wine bars. We thought it would be easier to take taxis into the city center for sightseeing, so if you do this, expect to pay roughly 7 Euros per one way trip - which is very inexpensive. I can't wait to return to Rome, and when I do, I will definatley stay at the Residenza.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful!”
Reviews.Author: BellaMom04
Reviews.Content: The staff is very welcoming. The hotel is a delight -- airy, bright and clean. They gave us good tips on sites to visit in Rome. We loved the neighborhood -- its twisty, narrow streets, the shops and restaurants, getting lost and finding our way "home."

Reviews.Title: “Nice weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: SuperTourist1234
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Residenza which is perfectly located. It is in a quite street with no traffic right in the center of Trastevere. There are plenty great restaurants in walking distance and uncounted bars where you can sip an espresso at the bar for 80 cents to one euro. Our room had windows to the little courtyard so there was not much light but that didn't bother us. During the night we heared base drums of the music played in some nearby discotheque. But as Trastevere is a lively place and we were totally exausted after sightseeing all day that was okay. Breakfast is served in a basement room. The food is good though not extraordinary. Tram line 8 is a two minute walk from the hotel and takes you close to Piazza Navona and the Pantheon (or to Trastevere station and from there you can catch a regional train to the airport which is a 25 minute ride).

Reviews.Title: “A delightful surprise”
Reviews.Author: Mistrkaz
Reviews.Content: In the labyinth of narrow, twisting streets called Trastevere, the Residenza may be difficult to find, but once you do you will be met by a host of pleasant experiences. It will begin with your gracious welcome by Giovanna at Reception and continue by finding your room to be stylish, clean, and unexpectedly spacious,and includes a complimentary and delightful breakfast. Laundry service is available and a free wireless computer is placed in the lobby for use by guests. The only comment I can offer on the opposite side of the spectrum is that the Residenza does not have 24 hour attendance at the front desk, consequently any problem arising in the unattended hours requires that you contact its "mother hotel" the Santa Maria a few blocks away for resolution. The Residenza has only six rooms and provides a unique and caring experience for the traveler looking for a great place to stay in Trastevere.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel, in a good location with perfect staff.”
Reviews.Author: stevere61
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome to watch a rugby match, six of us, all men. We found this hotel on the internet and thought we would give it a go. What a gem of a hotel! Perfectly placed in Trastevere, lots of restaurants and bars around. The rooms were very good, spacious and light, the breakfasts were tasty and the service could not have been better. We will certainly return in two years for the rugby, if not before for other reasons. This is our fifth trip to Rome and the hotel was by far the best.

Reviews.Title: “very good!”
Reviews.Author: Harry5926
Reviews.Content: Very friendly, service-minded and helpfull staff. Great location for eating out by night. Every monument in Rome is in walking distance. Every day clean towels and a good breakfast. Rooms are not very spacious but big enough to stay. HM Holland

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Residenza Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: Clackster57
Reviews.Content: Stayed in in February 2011 based on other reviews. Had a great stay and all the staff were very pleasant & helpful. This started at reception and included the staff who looked after the morning breakfast and the cleaning staff as well. The room was a good size with a double and single which worked well for us (we travelled with our 4 year old son). Good shower in the bathroom as well as bath, bidet etc. All the rooms are on the ground floor around a nice courtyard with orange trees (oranges not edible sadly!). During the warmer weather, breakfast can be taken in this area which would be very pleasant. The breakfast itself was buffet style with scrambled egg, cheeses, meats, fresh fruit & bread in good supply. An excellent Italian coffee finished it off nicely. The breakfast room itself is quite small but we always found seats. The service ran from 07:30 - 10:30 and was very relaxing. The staff were great - constantly busying themselves and attentive without being obtrusive. One small negative would be that the courtyard style of the hotel does mean that you can be aware of other guests arriving back from their evening out. To be fair, as we had a young child, we were back in our room by 20:30 at the latest - just the time when others would be venturing out. There was no disturbance to our son's sleeping (after hiking him around the Forum, the Vatican, St Peter's etc he had no problem in sleeping!) and after the first night my wife and I hardly noticed either. The surrounding area of Trastevere was all that we had hoped for. Full of local life & interesting with some excellent value restaurants as well as the stunning Basilica di Santa Maria which is well worth a visit along with the better known cultural highlights of Rome. We found it very easy to walk to and from all the major sites and the slightly less frenetic style of Trastevere was very nice to return to after a long day sightseeing. We will have no hesitation in returning to Residenza Santa Maria in the future and will happily recommend it as a great place to stay when visiting the wonderful city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful welcoming hotel, great location, friendly staff!"”
Reviews.Author: oregon81
Reviews.Content: We had a great four-night stay at the Residenza last week. The location is perfect for those who want to be in an authentic Roman neighborhood and in good walking distance to most of Rome's sights and sounds. The food choices in particular in this area were superb. The hotel facilities are in great condition, the rooms are very comfortable, the staff could not be nicer or more helpful, and there were no issues with outside noise seeping in from the busy streets. Lastly, we really enjoyed being a short walk from the scenery of the Tiber River and the wonderful food in the Jewish Ghetto quarter just across the river.

Reviews.Title: “Safe ,Clean, fantastico !!!”
Reviews.Author: amandayale
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is a real find.The staff are great all speak English and managed to get me a breakfast even though I was flying very early. Run very well,cant fault a thing.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Rome!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jose_Ruela
Reviews.Content: Again I dont hesitate to recommend Residenza Santa Maria. Trastevere is close to some of best turistic spots in rome, best food and beautiful scenario for a perfect weekend. You dont need to pay hundreds of euros to guarantee best accommodation. Kind staff, very clean, amazing breakfast! thanks again guys!

Reviews.Title: “Professionals”
Reviews.Author: Angelo_K82
Reviews.Content: If you are thinking of travelling in Rome for leisure or for business, this hotel is being greatly recommended!! Ran by professionals with kindness that they were helpful and thoughtful about my family. Charming rooms and nearby all the hotspots!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved our stay at Residenza Santa Maria-highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: elsiepolster
Reviews.Content: Chiara and the rest of the staff at Residenza Santa Maria were absolutely wonderful. We stayed two days prior and two day post our cruise. Chiara was helpful with recommendations for restaurants and things to see as well as helping us with arrangements from Rome to the port to and from our cruise ship. She speaks excellent English and made it comfortable for our limited Italian. I would highly recommend this hotel for a taste and feel of the Old Town of Rome and the lovely people and fantastic restaurants and shops.....Within walking distance of center Rome. Great location! Everything we hoped for and more!

Reviews.Title: “Good location with nice and clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: temeijer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located in the city center of Trastevere. Within 10 minutes you are in the center of Rome. The breakfast is good and the people of the hotel are friendly. We really can recommend this hotel!! Ciao Stefan and Isabelle

Reviews.Title: “Our first trip to Rome.”
Reviews.Author: svdmoot
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome. Thanks to the Residenza and staff it was a wonderful trip. Very friendly staff and our baby boy already misses the place. We stayed during Christmas. It's very close to the Tram stop (tram nr 8) which takes you to the Argentina Teatro. From here on the famous sites are at walking distance. You can buy a ticket at the closest Kiosk or at the tram's ticket machine (1 Euro, 75 mins.) Don't bother to buy an expensive ticket at the tourist busses. They only stop once in a while and the electronic guide (crappy headset) is always out off sync. Meaning that it tells you to look left, while the site is at the right or you just passed the site. I have just a few remarks for the Residenza staf. The Residenza lacks a bar & restaurant. We knew this at the time of booking, but with two little children it would be more value to the money. Above our room (room 6). People were doing the laundry until late in the evening. Besides the noise of people walking across the wooden floor in the upper room and the washing machine it was a very nice experience. We were so tired of walking all day.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get any better than this ...”
Reviews.Author: davidpjwilkinson
Reviews.Content: Quality residence offering something special with a unique blend of tradition and modernity and an opportunity to experience the real Roma. We stayed early December for four nights and booked in advance so the cost was very reasonable given the proximity to Christmas. We found the staff very friendly and helpful and the accommodation proved restful, spacious and of a high quality finish and upkeep. The location is hard to beat considering the ease of jumping onto buses with day passes and also walking to the major sights - although we didn't take sensible walking shoes with regret! There are loads of really charming and reasonably priced bars, cafes and restaurants within a couple of hundred yards of the accommodation plus the addition of unique establishments such as Bibli - a book shop with cafe (try the Sunday brunch) and the film library with bar. One small issue which might affect some is the recent addition of Banksi style fresco works popping up on every externally rendered surface! I hope the local council sort this one out as it does lower the tone somewhat! We would heartily recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “one of the friendliest places to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: gusseymanche
Reviews.Content: Residenza Santa Maria is in the heart of Trastevere, paces away from several top class restaurants. I got a suite with all modern amenities. Most of all I would like to recommend this place for the professionalism and friendly demenour of the staff, particularly Giovanna, who made sure my stay there was unforgettable. I would also like to add that the breakfast was top class. I will return to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in the City of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Elesem57
Reviews.Content: This small, family owned hotel is in the Trastevere area of Rome. We found the location to be ideal for walking to the historic sites. There are small cafes and restaurants near the hotel. The hotel staff is friendly and helpful. A light breakfast is served in a downstairs area each morning. Whenever I entered the doors of the hotel, I felt as though it was a center of calm in the busy city. Room was a nice size and the bathroom was one of the best we had our whole trip.

Reviews.Title: “Residenza Santa Maria is a wonderful small hotel with very friendly staff in an authentic neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: LRLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: The Residenza is located within walking distance of many major sites in Rome as well as several local shops and restaurants. Its proximity to the Piazza Santa Maria, public transportation stops and Trastevere train station is also a plus. I spent 6 nights at the hotel, and I would highly recommend it to anyone who appreciates being located off the tourist track where you can enjoy a Roman slice of life. My room was always clean, the nights were quiet, the breakfast was more than adequate, and the staff were warm and extremely helpful. I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: WLondon77
Reviews.Content: After 200 reviews there's very little new that I can add but it's worth reviewing to keep the ratings as high as they deserve to be. A really beautiful little gem - thoughtfully decorated and run by wonderfully friendly and helpful staff. The room was beautiful - granted no major views from the window but it was extremely spacious and the bathroom was to die for. Breakfast in a sweet little vaulted room on the lower ground floor was delicious- a nice buffet selection and lovely coffee. I can't imagine a nicer area of Rome to stay in than Trastevere - you can walk to all the major sites and the little windy streeets are beautiful and full of wonderful places to shop, eat and drink. You're only a very short walk from the river where you can stroll along the banks and it's wonderfully uncrowded. Major thumbs up and recommended to all. The only bad thing was the slightly painful price.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, romantic & comfortable, small hotel in quiet neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: gbu68
Reviews.Content: This very small (6 rooms) dependance of the Hotel Santa Maria lies in a very quiet part of Trastevere. It had very comfortable beds and rooms are of decent size. Breakfast quality is good. Quite a few good restaurants within walking distance. Very friendly staff, who also speak english. Centrally located between all the sites: Colosseum, Vatican, Pantheon, Forum Romanum are all within 30 min. walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: bruno.bemelmans
Reviews.Content: Everything is already said by other tripadvisor members. I just wanted to tell how wonderfull the staff is. When arriving at the airport to take out flight back home, my wife realised she forgot her handbag in the taxi - Big panic because everything was in that bag (money, credit cards, mobile etc) I immediately called the hotel and Giovanna assured me that she would find the bag. And indeed, after 5 days a delivery service brought the handbag with everything in it, even the money!! This is what I call service! Have a nice time in Rome and don't hesitate: choose la Residenza.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: MEGWAY
Reviews.Content: Residenza Santa Maria was the perfect hotel for our stay in Rome. We stayed in the family room which accommodated us all very comfortably. The hotel is in a great location in Trastevere and we loved wondering the streets finding a great spot to eat. It is close enough to the major sights to never cost more than 10 euro in a cab to get anywhere. We loved it and will definitely come back and stay the next time we are in Roma.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: JUDITHN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent two nights at the Residenza, after five nights on the Amalfi Coast. Chiara is one very special young woman, incredibly warm, and helpful at every turn. So, too, were Giovanna and Hussein, for the brief time we met them. The hotel is a lovely little haven in beautiful Trastevere, and a great place to come back to after a long day of touring. Our room was fabulous, very spacious and comfortable, with a charming little terrace. The bath was large, with a terrific rain shower, and very nice toiletries. Breakfast was excellent, served in a very attractive cellar. We had our choice of juices, yogurts, cereal, crusty bread and jams, pastries, prosciutto, salami, and cheese, and great fresh-brewed cappucino. The hotel arranged for our transfer to the airport, made restaurant reservations, and assisted us with our check-in for the return flight home. Grazie mille per un soggiorno molto piacevole. Judith and Peter Smith

Reviews.Title: “charming, great neighborhood, warm staff”
Reviews.Author: r2amelia
Reviews.Content: Very clean, great location, hotel connected w/ Hotel Santa Maria...they serve h'orderves/wine every afternoon. Breakfast had a good selection, breakfast room quite warm....as was hotel room even w/ AC on. Computer in lobby available for use, Wifi worked in lobby but not in room. Taxi service from hotel, walking distance to great restaurant Spirito di Vino in Trastevere and bus service. WONDERFUL staff.: Chiara & Giovanna. Room was small but comfortable. Would have preferred Hotel Santa Maria because of set-up(rooms around courtyard) but unavailable at time of our visit. Would recommend and return to the Residenza.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in residential area”
Reviews.Author: rjmrazik
Reviews.Content: Located in southwest area of Rome - about 20 to 30 minute walk to the tourist areas. The area comes alive at night with many great restaurants. Rooms were very nice and service wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel on our trip”
Reviews.Author: solstys
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after reading some of the reviews and we were very disappointed. The the location was seedy and the service was plainly atrocious. They never cleaned our room, weren't available at the desk half the time (they were often all eating in the dining room downstairs) and the male clerk there repeatedly asked us to pay even though we weren't leaving for 2 days! He was definitely the worst of them as he was in charge during the time when our room should have been cleaned also. But all of the employees took no care in providing any service and this was topped off by them leaving our luggage in the main lobby area when we were out for a last excursion after having to check out. They had initially placed it in a closet, but for some odd reason, when we got back, there it was in the lobby unattended. I highly recommend staying in a place closer to the main sites and not on this side of the river as at night, it can become a bit sketchy. But that's not the main problem at this hotel. If you value reasonable service, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Over the top! Many key values!”
Reviews.Author: Hallsimon
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed here for 3 nights. This is the very nice hotel as its old look has been preserved very well. Its cleanliness of the room and friendliness of the staff are the two keypoints of the hotel. - The hotel is only 15 minute walk from the Roman Forum. Moreover it is close to excellent restaurants, shops, bars as well as many other sights. - Note that it offer free wireless internet access, - Make sure you taek the breakfast as the food is very good Anyway, this is an wonderful place and a great choice if you manage to book this.

Reviews.Title: “Got overbooked. Please check your reservation in advance.”
Reviews.Author: jmginger
Reviews.Content: After our reservation and initial confirmation, we got a message from the hotel desk that our room had been overbooked. We were offered a more expensive room, which we found unacceptable. We had to cancel the reservation and booked somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A charming, value for money, centrally located hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MizzGibson
Reviews.Content: A quaint hotel situated withing easy walking distance of all the main attractions. We found the rooms to be of good size and clean with the added bonus of air conditioning. Although centrally located just off the main square it was quiet at night. Staff were very pleasant and always willing to help. Would reccomend as a value for money place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mkfore244
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved staying here in the heart of the Trastevere neighborhood. It was located on a little side street away from the noise of the city. And when you step outside the hotel you know that you are in Rome. We stayed here are last couple of nights on our Honeymoon and we loved it. The rooms were great and the price was awesome. Some of the amenities located at the mother hotel a few blocks away, but we did not bother going because we had everything we needed. When we return we will be going here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull staff, home from home...”
Reviews.Author: Arienne
Reviews.Content: Lovely litte hotel in Trastevere, the neighborhood in Rome where it feels like the Rome you 've imagenend at home, narrow cobblestoned streets and very old houses and piazza's, not as crowded with tourists and noisy as the center of Rome. The service in this hotel is excellent, good breakfast, fine rooms, sometimes a little noisy. (But that's Rome for you...). Nice restaurants and a good winebar "Trastevere" nearby. The hotel receptionist is extremely helpful with reservations and information. I want to go back...now!

Reviews.Title: “Wish we had more time here”
Reviews.Author: jojosmomma
Reviews.Content: We spent our first three nights in another hotel in the Rome area. That hotel could not accomodate us for the final night, so we booked the Residenza Santa Maria, based on the reviews on TripAdvisor. I wish we had stayed at the Santa Maria the whole time. What a great find. The location is a little hard to find in Trastevere, but the staff and serene rooms more than make up for the inconvenience. We arrived a little before 1 pm and our room was not ready yet. We were tired and hot after wrestling our luggage over cobblestone streets from the bus stop and getting lost. The desk clerk brought us chilled water and settled us in the little sitting area adjacent to the front desk. My husband went to the restroom to freshen up. While he was away, the clerk informed me that the room was ready. She helped me move our bags into the room. The room was basic but large, with a king size bed, TV and full bathroom. It was very quiet. There are only six rooms in this hotel. This is not the place to stay if you are wanting to party in your room. A happy hour reception is served at the sister property, which is a 5 minute walk away. I loved the little orange grove where they have tables set up to enjoy the afternoon. You have to purchase the drinks, but the snacks are free. We sat and enjoyed a glass of wine and some delicious bruschetta and other snacks. The included breakfast buffet was wonderful. They serve it in a little breakfast room that features brick arches, warm lighting, and soft Jazz playing on the stereo. The breakfast offered several meats, breads, cereal, fruits and hard boiled eggs. You could order specialty coffee at no charge. There were a variety of juices offered also. It was easily the best breakfast we had while in Italy. We borrowed the hotel bikes that morning and went for a ride. Crossing the Ponte Sisto immediately takes you into Rome, not far from many historical sites. Trastevere is colorful and lively and we really enjoyed it. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Rome”
Reviews.Author: sproper
Reviews.Content: If you want to see real Italians in action, you want to stay in this area. It is a further walk to all the tourist sites but well worth it. This small boutique hotel is simple but lovely and pristinely clean. The staff was extremely helpful. The buffet breakfast was high quality. They have a PC in the lobby where you can access the internet. This is a low profile hotel but you can step outside onto the area's winding streets and be in the heart of the evening action. I would come back in a minute to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little spot”
Reviews.Author: JLeslie22
Reviews.Content: What a great way to be introduced to Rome. When we made our reservation, we were emailed the next day to ask if we needed any tour information. On arrival, we were greeted warmly and were allowed to use the free internet in the lobby and to leave our luggage (we got there too early to check in) while we went out to tour the city. We were only in Rome for one day/night, and due to our arrival and departure times, and the time we spent touring the city, we were not able to take advantage of the complimentary breakfast or dinner that was offered. We arrived just as breakfast was being cleared but everything looked fresh and appetizing. The location is wonderful on a quiet little street with loads of restaurants nearby. It was easy to walk to the Ponte Sisto bridge and Piazza Navona, and Trastevere is a great neighborhood to check out at night. Our room was large enough for us to have 3 large suitcases on the floor and still move around, and the bathroom was roomy and very clean. We had a quad room with a queen bed and bunk beds, and my daughter complained that it wasn't easy to climb up to the top bunk. The decor was average -- not great, not bad. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Now, that's breakfast! And location too!”
Reviews.Author: MisterCoconut
Reviews.Content: If staying in Trastevere, this is a fantastic location! Just a hop away from everything, but in a quieter street. Also, very friendly and helpfull staff makes it a lovely small hotel. There is free internet, but not WIFI. Hopefully an upgrade will come. Rooms are relatively spacious, but many face inwards to the cortile, yard, with no view. Aircondition takes care of the urge to open a window, though. The rooms are decorated in what is supposed to be Italian-romantic style. A little over done, and not particularly tasteful, but clean and with everything you need. Bathrooms were nice too. Breakfast was truly great! A lot of fresh choices and coffee made to order. Not many small hotels puts this much energy into breakfast. It was greatly appreciated! It is a small hotel, so no other meals are available, but there are dozens of restaurants right around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nmduleba
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect: Trastavere was a great neighborhood to be in; the service was excellent: everyone we dealt with polite and cheerful and helpful; the room was comfortable if a little crowded with two adults and two teenagers and breakfast and afternoon snacks as well!! We enjoyed our visit very much! So much nicer than a huge Hilton or Marriot.

Reviews.Title: “A total gem -- best location, best price, best people”
Reviews.Author: JT553
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I did a weekend in Rome before heading to the Amalfi coast. We researched Rome hotels for a while, wanting to pick the perfect spot, and definitely made a great decision. The reviews on tripadvisor peaked our interest, and then we found that most other sources (travel books, other online sites, etc.) had similarly great things to say about the hotel, so we went for it. To start, the location can't be beat. It's walkable to pretty much everything, yet away from the craziness of downtown tourist-filled Rome. It's located in Trastevere, an authentic italian neighborhood with great cafes, beautiful streets, etc. I've been to Rome a few times, but this was my first time in Trastevere. I would recommend the area highly, and certainly wouldn't stay anywhere else when visiting Rome again. The hotel: it's VERY small. One floor, with no more than 8 to 10 rooms. I prefer that though, rather than being in a huge hotel where you feel like just a number, and just another guest. They knew us by name, were incredibly kind and accommodating, gave great restaurant recommendations, etc. It was very clean, well maintained, and updated. I would agree with a previous reviewers' comment that the photos on-line don't really do the hotel/rooms justice. My one hesitation from reading previous reviews were complaints about the rooms not having enough light/not being airy enough. We stayed in a triple, which had a very small patio and we could open the doors, which was a nice touch and provided plenty of light/air. Maybe we were just lucky -- i didn't get a chance to see what the other rooms were like. The room, like the hotel, was very clean and very well maintained, but it was rather small. Also, I would describe the room as better than basic, but certainly not luxurious. If you are looking for luxury in Rome, you're going to be paying 3 times the cost of this place. Oh yeah, and breakfast was a nice bonus! Coffee bar, pastries, fruit, eggs -- all included. For the location, the accommodations, and the service, this place can't be beat. Would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and well-appointed”
Reviews.Author: jeffpaloalto
Reviews.Content: Very nice room for four - a double bed and two bunkbeds. Very clean and quiet with double-pain windows keeping all noise out. Being in the Trastevere area, you're a little out of the mainstream put provided the weather isn't too hot, you can get to transportation pretty easily. Very well run and attentive to your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel and the best cappuccino at breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: lastminuteoverpacker
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other reviewers that this was a wonderful place to stay. Our family of 4 stayed in a family room with 2 bunks. An added bonus was the small courtyard off the room with a table and 2 chairs. The bathroom was wonderfully equipped with a bathtub which included a shower. The cappuccino at breakfast was the best we had on our 2 1/2 week trip in Italy. Service was friendly and helpful, we enjoyed the location, and everything was very clean. We highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MMCSanDiego
Reviews.Content: We were with our teenage daughters and stayed 4 nights here. We loved the location in Trastevere. Wonderful outdoor cafes and a lively plaza and some shopping. Walking distance to most of the sights. Staff was friendly and the breakfast was great. We had a room with a queen bed and bunk beds. It was very comfortable and clean for four people. There was a computer in the lobby with high speed internet and comfortable common rooms for reading etc. The sister hotel a short distance away had a free evening buffet outside which was really nice. We really enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Place to Stay in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: bostontraveler0
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I stayed at the Residenza Santa Maria for 3 nights on a recent trip to Rome. The Residenza Santa Maria is a lovely hotel on a street off the Piazza Santa Maria in Trastevere. The hotel is in a perfect location, close to excellent restaurants, shops, bars and in the heart of Rome’s best neighborhood. The small hotel has an outstanding staff, free wireless internet access, wonderful breakfast, large rooms and a welcoming and comfortable atmosphere. The staff at the hotel made our experience memorable and was available to answer any question. The rooms were quite large for European standards, with air-conditioning, comfortable bed, frig and a good sized bathroom. This hotel is a must stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A gem with elegance, history and ambiance you will have a hard time beating.”
Reviews.Author: Michael55
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night, but my daughter, upon walking into the hotel of only 7 rooms gasped with delight. The old world charm has been preserved. The cleanliness and friendliness of the staff the best. And the breakfast room...very cool. This hotel is on our list to come back to. It is located in a perfect part of Trastevere...easy to access Campo di Fiori, and a short 15 minute walk to the Roman Forum. So, you get it all.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel in a fun neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: karawebster
Reviews.Content: Perfect stay, would return again for certain. Our room was spacious, and quiet. Have nothing but great things to say.

Reviews.Title: “A great little b&b in a great location”
Reviews.Author: digga_10
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff were always friendly and able to help. Thankyou!

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to a good daily cappucino!”
Reviews.Author: estherdiamond1
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Residenza Santa Maria exceeded our expectations. The staff were more than accommodating, from faxing articles to the USA (at no charge) to advising on areas to visit/eating out and also booking private guide and car for the morning. Stefano even loaned us money until we could buy euros from the bank. Enjoyed the accommodation which was very clean and the breakfasts (cappucino daily) were great.My spouse and I look forward to staying at this hotel again when we next visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: NYCDee29
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Residenza Santa Maria for 4 nights, 3 of which were at the beginning of my trip and another 1 night when we returned to Rome at the end of our trip. I HIGHLY recommend this hotel. I traveled with my husband, and also my parents. My husband and I are in our 30s and my parents in their 60s and 70s and there is plenty to do in teh neighborhood for all ages. The hotel is sooo charming and the rooms are BIG for European standards! Service is impeccable, as everyone is so friendly and welcoming. I truly felt like I was at home or with family! The area of the hotel is a hop skip and jump away from the Piazza Santa Maria and Trastevere is home to many wonderful restaurants and markets. There is a tram about a block or two away that can take you to all the major tourist attractions, but we enjoyed just walking around Trastevere especially at night. The hotel also has a laptop in the lobby that is free to use, which was a great convenience. I highly recommend the Residenza Santa Maria for couples, families, or solo's. We will definitely be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “oasis of charme and tranquility”
Reviews.Author: Family22Loerrach
Reviews.Content: The Residenza is ideally located within lively Trastevere with lots of shops, bars and restaurants, and yet a place of tranquility to relax from a busy day in this great city. The hotel is clean, the room is made up perfectly each day, and the bathroom facilities within this old building work without any problems. The breakfast offers a nice variety to start your day, and it is not at all a problem that the room in the basement has no windows. It is very relaxing to start a day as a family there. The hotel staff is always very friendly, and the Residenza provides a very personal atmosphere. You don't really feel like being in a hotel. Travelers going there seem to cherish this atmosphere and this makes any stay even more pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “A marvellous hotel, great and warm welcome, very large and nice bedroom, hotel with a lot of charm, very quiet, very wel”
Reviews.Author: isabelle13Paris
Reviews.Content: very welle situated in trastevere, hotel full of charm, a great and warm welcome, very quite , nice and large bedroom, very clean

Reviews.Title: “Dedicated staff make the most of this tiny hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MuggsSaskatoon
Reviews.Content: While our window opened onto the outdoors (not all of them do), it was very quiet. The breakfast was tops, in particular the excellent cappuccino and chocolate. But what sets this hotel apart from others is its staff, always friendly and willing to help. When we needed medical attention, Chiara quickly got us an appointment with a specialist at a nearby hospital (another plus). A very nice place to stay in Trastevere, which seems like a smaller town. You may want to take a bus or tram to get to major shopping or historic sites.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely oasis”
Reviews.Author: DMMTM
Reviews.Content: In Rome, it is so important to have an oasis at the end of a long day of trekking to the wonderful sights the city has to offer. The Residenza Santa Maria offered just that. With its six rooms, we felt like we were staying in someone's home while maintaining our privacy. The entire place is well appointed including their breakfast room which used to be an old cistern. Each member of the hotel staff was gracious, very helpful and treated us as if they've known us for quite some time. On our first day there, we met the owner, Stefano (who is a treasure trove of information about Rome), who told us not only about which restaurants to dine in but which dishes to order with which wine and he was on target! He also told us about a lovely museum (it was actually someone's home) with great art that was not frequented by most tourists. That was also quite a treat! We are so thankful to Stefano, his sister Chiara, Giovanna, Giuliana, Hussein, Arturo and the rest of the Residenza staff for making our stay in Rome a lovely experience, full of warm smiles. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Great little romantic hideaway in top location”
Reviews.Author: rhabarberschnecke
Reviews.Content: We really loved this little (6 rooms only!) quiet and romantic hideaway in a huzzling & buzzling Trastevere (the place to be in Rome for all people who like beautiful restaurants and interesting little shops in a romatic but very lively sourounding). It is amazing that around this place thousands of people seem to enjoy the great scenery of restaurants and bars strolling around the streets of Trastevere whereas the the hotel is that quiet and relaxing that we really enjoyed our stay in spaceous and nicely equiped rooms and fully equipped bathrooms of spotless cleanlyness. The service staff was always very friendly and helpful, especially the ladies at the front desk. Only the breakfast service was somehow different, as sometimes we waited quite some time for someone coming around to assist us although we had been clearly recognized and had been the only breakfast guests at that time. This is the only point of criticism at all and did not really spoil our mood. The hotel is top located next to a Tiber bridge to centro historico and we managed the Vatikan, the Colosseum and the Forum Roman by waking there. Whenever we will visit Rome again, for sure we will stay in this place again! Thanks a lot for this great place!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel, fantastic staff, superb location”
Reviews.Author: biba07
Reviews.Content: Mum taking her 13yr old son to Rome for his Birthday treat, from the start reception very helpful and friendly, room ideal for our needs. Location for us excellent as we could walk every where to all main attractions, loads of choice of local restaurants in the evenings, and felt a safe enviroment. Visited the main hotel and loan of free bikes an experience on the cobbled streets, lots laughter. Had a lot of hassle on return home day as our flight back to Edinburgh cancelled due to volcano, won't mention unhelpful airline, but hotel staff helped every way they could. Will return for sure. Went to this hotel due to good write up on trip advisor

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not cheap”
Reviews.Author: Palsom
Reviews.Content: The residenza is nice and cosy, but a bit pricy. Welcoming staff. Breakfast quite good. The rooms are large but a bit dark since they are located at the ground floor and have small windows. The residenza is quiet and the area has lots of wonderful restaurants, cafes and bars. Walking distance to other main sights on the other side of the Tevere river.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: stringman101
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights. Trestevere is a nice section of Rome, easy walk across the Tiber to ancient Rome and without any of touristy hype you feel in parts of old Rome. Many good restaurants ot choose from, lots of tiny streets and hidden piazzas. Very safe and easy to walk at night. The hotel is clean, quiet and friendly. Staff was really helpful. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Roman experience!”
Reviews.Author: Sue154973
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved the hotel. We were a bit apprehensive when driving up the small laneway approaching the hotel due to the amount of grafitti in the streets but as soon as we walked in we knew it was going to be fabulous. We have told everyone we meet about it!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Webz4
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Residenza and thoroughly recommend it. Despite being in the lively Trastevere area of Rome, our nights sleep were undisturbed in a cool, comfortable family room. Great shower! Breakfast was super with a choice of pastries, cereal and fruit..and lovely coffee. The hotel is beautifully decorated, full of character and you truly feel that you are in Italy. The staff are always friendly, polite and happy to help. We had our best meal at Le Mani in Pasta - but make sure you book ahead, and another in Alle Fratte di Trastevere (speedy service with quaffable house wine!). Fior di Luna round the corner does fab ice-cream. We walked everywhere from the hotel, from the Colloseum to the Vatican. Brilliant location.

Reviews.Title: “Okay - but did not meet our expectations”
Reviews.Author: vibsoe
Reviews.Content: We wanted to live in the centre off the old Rome and quiet. That we found. The staff (except the woman serving breakfast) were very friendly. It was clean etc. But we were dissapointed with two things. First off all our room was dark - it felt like being in a cellar - and the window faced a brick wall. The breakfast was mainly a lot of dry cakes - where were the promissed crossaints etc. It was in total fine - but the price was too high compared to what we got.

Reviews.Title: “3 Generations in Rome”
Reviews.Author: dmg3
Reviews.Content: My mother and I went to visit my daughter who is studying in Rome. Her apartment is in Trastevere, but she stayed with us in the Residenza Santa Maria. From the time we opened the door to walk into the lobby, we knew we were going to have a wonderful experience. The lobby was warm and the staff was welcoming. Any questions we had, were answered. The room was large and spotless, as was the bathroom. Any needs we had were taken care of immediately. We had a problem getting a taxi to get to the airport since it was the night before Easter and Rome was bustling. The gentleman at the desk kept trying, at least 5 companies, until he was able to get us a cab. The location is excellent. It's on a quiet street, just a short walk to the Piazza di Santa Maria. Can't wait to go back to show my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: dorothy050
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome a few years ago in a different area, but this time chose to stay in Trastevere. We had a superb time, excellent location, close enough to the obvious 'touristy' places but far enough away from the crowds. Thoroughly recommend going this time of year. Lovely hotel and staff very friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend it and can't wait to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, charming, clean...”
Reviews.Author: MitaT
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, charming, clean. Would definitely go back and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “It can't get any better”
Reviews.Author: ProgHippie
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, good breakfast, cozy and well equipped, lovely designed rooms with great facilities, perfect location, unbeatable value. Clearly one of the best hotels i've ever been to.

Reviews.Title: “Without Fault!”
Reviews.Author: Ross_k77
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights in the Residenzia Santa Maria with my girlfriend and we had a fantastic time, the hotel is located within walking distance of all the main sights (we did get the bus (Number 23)to the vatican but realistically its in easy walking distance). Trastevere has many good bars and restaurants all within 2 minutes from the hotel. The breakfast was great and the staff could not be more helpfull, there is free wifi and also a comunal lap top in reception. The pictures on the web really do not do it justice and make the hotel/b&B look quite dated when it really is quite the opposite. If managment read this i would recommend modernising your website as again it does not do your lovely little establishment justice.

Reviews.Title: “CHARMING, LOVED IT...WANT TO GO BACK!”
Reviews.Author: earlybird14
Reviews.Content: At first, the graffiti on the walls of Trastevere was a little off-putting...but it soon faded from sight when the charm of this section of Rome swept us off our feet! Visited for 4 days in February with our 20-something daughter (a Christmas present from her!), and we were totally charmed. Our room was large and comfortable, perfect for 3 people. Loved the free use of the computer in the lobby, and the more than adequate breakfast each morning. The streets of Trastevere are narrow and cobblestoned, and FULL in the evenings, even in February! We loved exploring, shopping, sampling the baked goods and cappuchino in the many nearby shops and cafes. There are so many GREAT restaurants nearby, it's hard to make a decision! But one of our favorites was Le Mani in Pasta, a 10 minute walk (37 Via dei Genovesi...try the Spaghetti alla Vernaccia, or Tagliolini cacio e pepe...mmmmmmmm). TIP: make a reservation, it's great food at great prices and is maxed out every night! Another 10 minute walk takes you to a taxi stand OR the trolley stop, for a very quick and inexpensive trip across the Tiber to the historic sites of Rome. If you have a lot of time, it's even within walking distance. Ask any taxi to bring you back to the Ponte Garibaldi, and you are a 5 minute walk from the Inn, (although do-able, it is difficult for taxi's to take you to the door step, due to the narrow roads, and we always enjoyed the walk!). The staff was always warm and more than willing to help with recommendations, directions, umbrella's, etc. We always felt safe, welcomed, and we would go back in a minute; AND have already recommended this place to friends for a September trip!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - hotel & location - would recommend to all”
Reviews.Author: aalz
Reviews.Content: We are just back from 3 nights in Rome (early Feb 2010) - staying at Residenza Santa Maria - we had the family room - 2 adults / 2 children (6 & 8) very clean rooms / very comfortable / best shower ever - fabulous breakfast - great location - easy to walk to colosseum & forums (20 mins) or to St Peters also 20 mins (although lots of buses over the bridge - for the kids tired legs on the way back!) Lovely atmosphere in Trastavere in the evening - faboulous restaurants and lots of them very very reasonable. If you like smaller hotels / b&bs for a quieter / personal stay - but still want to stay somewhere lovely - this is the place....I booked due to the recommendations on trip advisor - so take our word for it. What a perfect time to go to Rome - no queues -and what a perfect place to stay. Also to mention took the H bus from Station Termini to Trastavere & back again - very easy & quick.

Reviews.Title: “The best care we had in Italy!”
Reviews.Author: ViajanteBRSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good, clean, well located, and the officials are very caring. Very good! I recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet, clean, attractive with excellent service in a fun neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: hopsinn
Reviews.Content: For Rome, reasonable rates, spacious, clean and attractive rooms. Recently remodeled with eye-pleasing decor. Only 6 rooms on one floor, set back with virtually no outside noise. Located in the Trastavere neighborhood with its "local" flavor and many outdoor cafes. An easy walk across the Tiber to the Colosseum, Roman Forum etc. Chiara, our host, was exceptionally accommodating, arranging transportation when we needed it and an early breakfast on the day of our departure from Rome. We will stay here again if returning to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Residenza Santa Maria was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: kleinbluhm
Reviews.Content: The staff was very nice and helpful, always available for questions. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. I stayed for a few nights and then left to go to Sorrento for a night. When I came back my new room was ready and my luggage was there for me too. If you are going to the center of Rome you may need to take taxis but the front desk will call one for you and I didn't have to wait more than 5 minutes any day. Although the neighborhood is lively at night, the Santa Maria is very calm and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “excellant choice and location superb”
Reviews.Author: carriesanfrancisco
Reviews.Content: Our grandson studied in Trastaverde and recommended this location. The staff were most helpful and breakfast was excellant. Location to public transportation excellant/walking to many areas excellant, especially along the river for quiet and fresh air. The staff recommended excellant restaurants in the area. Local fare and not expensive. We are from San Francisco and do not like being tourists. We felt right at home. We look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - highly, highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Cath A
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residenza Santa Maria for just a couple of nights (not long enough) in mid December as a pre-Christmas treat. We'd never stayed in Trastevere before although we know Rome quite well. The staff at the SM were absolutely lovely from the first minute we walked into the hotel. They were friendly, knowledgeable, efficient and unfailingly helpful. They recommended places to eat, how to get to sights, organised a taxi back to the airport and generally couldn't do enough to help. The hotel is a lovely building, very well refurbished. Original stone arches and wooden beamed ceilings combine with modern fittings to make it a beautiful and comfortable place to be. It's centrally heated in the winter so was lovely and warm. It also has air conditioning which would be essential in the summer. Our room (number 3) was spotlessly clean, and spacious for Rome, could sleep four and had a gorgeous bathroom with the most amazingly luxurious shower I've ever had - very necessary after a hard day's sightseeing. We even had our own little terrace complete with bistro table and two chairs. The bed was wonderfully comfortable and the hotel is very quiet - we slept like logs. The breakfast was again reasonable (although I would like to have been offered more than one cup of coffee) and there's a complimentary lunch at the nearby hotel Santa Maria. The price included internet access (there's a public laptop if you haven't got your own with you) and breakfast and was very good value. The only drawback was it's a but of a walk to the city centre - about twenty minutes - although there's a tram which goes very regularly. Staying in the Trastevere is like staying in a small, friendly Italian village. It's probably not for you if it's your first time in Rome as you'll want to be more central, but if you want a peaceful haven away from Rome's hassle, you won't get better than this. One final word - I was a bit worried about the graffitti I saw in the area when I looked on Google earth street view. Don't be. Trastevere is a great area to stay and I've never felt safer than I did when staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: WhitePigeon
Reviews.Content: Everything seemed too good to be true. The staff were so friendly and helpful and really went above and beyond. Dinner recommendations, car service and lattes before we left for the airport - even though breakfast didn't start for another 2 hours. The rooms were charming and really well sized. We'll be back for sure and will spread the word to everyone in Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: gogo3b
Reviews.Content: Very well located in the city center, special breakfast, great rooms and free internet. A special thanks to Chiara very profesional and helpful. Near by the hotel there are many good restourants.

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise....even better than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: CiaoNow
Reviews.Content: Located in the old neighborhood of Trastevere - colourful narrow streets filled with heritage, great trattorias and exceptional coffee and gelato. Our room was very clean and quite large especially for Europe, very comfortable - excellent bathroom - again clean, well appointed and great shower. The staff were very friendly, helpful and nothing was too much trouble.....especially the lovely Chiara....she made us feel at home in the first two minutes and each day did her very best in all areas to assist us. Thanks for a wonderful first stay in Rome......we will be back!! Ciao Chiara! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Calm in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: parisp81
Reviews.Content: The Residenza Santa Maria was everything we could have hoped for. A haven of calm and tranquility amidst the hussle and bussle of Rome. Close to everything we wanted to see and most importantly, very clean and well appointed. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, competent and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Ripheus
Reviews.Content: I stayed sixteen nights, half of the time by myself and half with friends. I have been to Rome before and decided that this time I wanted to stay in Trastevere. It was a very good choice, because all the sights, from the Vatican to the historic center are easily accessible. The staff gave attentive service, and spoke English well. Besides, they gave very good advice on places to eat, which has become important in Rome. The breakfast was very good, if not a typical American breakfast it was a vast step up from the Italian custom of coffee and roll. And the free evening snack buffet at the nearby Santa Maria hotel was a very nice addition. Only six rooms, and people buzzed in, so seems quite safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bang for your Buck!”
Reviews.Author: JandSRaleigh_NC
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff, excellent location and accommodation with great buffet breakfast by European standards. Will definitely stay there again and will recommend to family and friends!

Reviews.Title: “Reason to come back in Rome”
Reviews.Author: paris20vt
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, fantastic rooms for its category, very clean rooms with nice atmosphere

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: xxxxname
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay at this small inn located in Trastevere area of Rome. Location is about 50 meters from the church of Santa Maria in Trastevere. Staff was very helpful with transportation advice (also dining suggestions) in Rome. The nearest metro is Piramide which is a 30 minute walk, but there is bus and tram service within a 3 minute walk of the inn. Breakfast was abundant and excellent quality. Evening buffet at the Santa Maria hotel also a nice way to start the evening. Many nice restaurants and bars within walking distance to the inn. If you take a taxi to the hotel it might be best to have the driver drop you in the Santa Maria in Trastevere square. Our driver had considerable trouble locating the inn because it was not in her GPS.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and staff was awsome.”
Reviews.Author: rfarina1
