Reviews.Content: You have an employee name Ciara I beleive, she was great. She helped us with resturants which had the best food, she is an asset to your hotel. Staff was friendly an even though I spoke some Italian they were very nice to speak english to us. I would recommend your hotel to anyone who is traveling to Rome.. Ciao, Giovanni Farina

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodation, staff and location”
Reviews.Author: Pookie355
Reviews.Content: We were more them pleased with the accomodations at Residenza Santa Maria. The quality of accomodation and location was excellent for the price. We were able to find lots of good restaurants close by and walk to any of the sights in Rome. We never used public transportation during our stay other then to and from the airport. Coming back to the hotel after a day in Rome was very welcoming. We instantly decompressed from the noise and business of the city as the hotel was quiet and the decor calming. The public spaces in the hotel were comfortable and provided a space to meet with friends or other guests. The staff were accomodating, friendly and their English was very good. The rooms were large, well furnished , immaculate and quiet. We also had the opportunity to visit the Hotel Santa Maria and made use of the bar . Again this was a nice space to be able to utilize away from the noise of the city. They provided nice snacks and the prices of the drinks were reasonable. We would highly ecommend this hotel to stay in and if visiting ROme again would definitely book here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay, quiet, secluded, peaceful.”
Reviews.Author: TexasAli
Reviews.Content: Residenza Santa Maria is a great place to stay. The room was large and spacious compared with other hotels in Rome. Bathroom had a super shower, tub, and all the amenities needed to prepare for a day out in Rome. The hotel staff was always courteous and helpful. The hotel is in a quaint old neighborhood (Trastevere) where one can escape from the hustle-bustle of Rome central and relax in the peace and quiet across the Tiber. It was a perfect place to stay as we wound down our Italian vacation. Grazie!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure in Trastevere!”
Reviews.Author: dukduk18
Reviews.Content: This hotel went beyond my expectations! Upon arrival we were a little leary because it is in Trastevere and there was a lot of grafitti not to mention our taxi driver couldn't drop us off right out in front so he stopped and let us out and then pointed in the direction we should walk. We only had to go about a block and thenn got buzzed into a lovely hotel. You wouldn't guess it from the outside but the inside is quiet and serene. There is a lovely check in area that has a lounge off to the right with free internet and couches. Then you walk through another cute sitting area to get to your room. The rooms were larger than anything else we saw in Europe and they were clean and comfortable. We had a great stay and would recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Small comfortable hotel in Testavere”
Reviews.Author: chuckAZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one evening at the end of our vacation before returning to USA. Small but very comfortable hotel in a quiet neighborhood yet close walking distance to major cutural sites across the river. Hotel location provided the opportunity for us to relax but be close to many restaurants in the lively Testavere neighborhood. Preferred it over the nearby sister hotel. Would definitely stay here again when we return to Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkViaggiatrice
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for two nights in September. We got a last-minute deal and we were both looking forward to our stay--especially since this B&B has gotten such good reviews. However, we were sorely disappointed. The Residenza is certainly in a great location. Trastevere is a charming, lively part of Rome. There are good places to eat, interesting shops, and the nearby church, Santa Maria in Trastevere, is a marvel. However, contrary to what others have said, our room at the Residenza was not as clean as we would have liked (particularly the floors). There was a dingy feel to the whole of it, including the lobby and the breakfast area. All in all, the place seemed run-down and in need of a makeover. The staff was pleasant enough, but perhaps a bit young and inexperienced. We would never stay again and would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time!Location, Room, Service everything was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: SidoniaUtrecht
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. The location was perfect; everything in Rome by foot! A lot to see just around the corner. Great nightlife too. The staff was very nice; helping us to find good restaurants, always very friendly. The breakfast: there was enough to choose for everyone. The room was large enough, airconditioned and a great shower and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely charming stay”
Reviews.Author: Shergld
Reviews.Content: The place is charming, the location is great and the staff was friendly. The staff couldn't be more helpful. The sister hotel nearby welcomes guests from Residenza and that has the same charm and warm welcome. Feels lie you're in a small town rather than a big city.

Reviews.Title: “Combines value for money with an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Man_from_Devon
Reviews.Content: We wanted a value for money hotel in a quiet location and yet within easy reach of Rome's major attractions, and we found this hotel to fit the bill perfectly. A clean and comfortable room with excellent facilities where we were assured of a good night's rest. It was very useful to have access to the internet from our room (via ethernet network cable - provided by hotel). The staff were always very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and stylish accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Grandtour_9
Reviews.Content: Large room and ensuite bathroom, stylish decor, helpful staff. excellent location for restaurants and great evening atmosphere of the Trastevere area. Not far to walk to all the historical sites of Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location. Best Staff”
Reviews.Author: marquelynn
Reviews.Content: This area was so much fun.. At first sight you get a little nervous but as you explore the square and the streets you fall in love with its true Roman charm and the people that live there. What a great experience. We had a great time there and the staff were the best. They stored our bags for two days as we slimmed down for a two night stay at the Amalfi coast and then returned to them. It was like going back home. The rooms were gorgeous and they were so welcoming. Don't miss going into the church it is one of the oldest in Rome and I think one of the most gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “great location friendly staff good value”
Reviews.Author: randell1852
Reviews.Content: very convenient location near tram stop .good range local restaurants and bars residence tricky to find but peaceful with comfortable but not luxurious rooms Only criticism of room was that TV showed shopping channel only Staff very friendly and helpful and all spoke good english Very decent quality breakfast Would happily stay here again as it is good value for Rome where all hotels are expensive. If book direct with Residencia on line or phone and pay with cash get 10% discount

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: SmileLT
Reviews.Content: Our stay in this hotel exceeded expectations! Cozy interior of the hotel and excellent service by friendly staff made our stay in Rome unforgettable. The hotel is situated very close to the center of the city in Transtevere and is surrounded by small cafes and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A PERFECT GEM OF A HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: MrsSScotland
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this beautiful hotel for two nights with my mother and daughter before we travelled on to a family wedding in Naples. The Residenza is without doubt a hidden gem of Trastevere, and though slightly more expensive than some in the area it is well worth paying the extra money to stay in such an exeptionally lovely place. Our room was beautifully furnished to a very high standard, as is the rest of the hotel. - in fact the internet photos don't really show how lovely the place really is. Tthe best things about it are the beautifully furnished rooms, which are comfortable and quite, the breakfast room which offers a high quality buffet selection (and excellent coffee) and the wonderful staff how are so helpful and friendly. We had a really comfortable and peaceful stay and I would thoroughly recommend the Residenza to anyone looking to stay in the Trastevere area. I've already reommended it to friends and family and hope that I may be able to come back some time soon for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely little home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: wdkgbun
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the Residenza. All correspondence with them prior to the trip was answered very promptly. The hotel arranged for a car to meet us at the airport. Our room was newly decorated with a double bed and two bunk beds. It was spotlessly clean. The decor in the hotel is charming and the staff very friendly and helpful. We inadvertently left a bag at the airport and they called the airport for me. I had to go and retrieve the bag but the concierge was able to give me directions to take local transit and the train at minimum effort and cost. We also had trouble with our electrical transformer and the hotel provided us with one. The breakfast provided was just right - fresh fruit, cereal, pastries, cheese, yogurt and cold meat with coffee (latte or cappuccino if desired) and a selection of juice. The eating area is a lovely little room in the basement - again very clean. The hotel is located right at the Piazza Santa Maria - a real gathering place for people, particularly at night after dinner. We enjoyed drinks in the cafes, gelato and dinner in local eateries. The hotel is about 20 minutes walk from the Coliseum and 45 from the Vatican. We walked everywhere. Overall, I was thrilled with our stay in Rome at the Residenza Santa Maria

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful unassuming authentic italian hotel”
Reviews.Author: shelbear
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We stayed at this hotel earlier this month for 4 nights and found it a wonderful property to experience Rome to it's fullest. We arrived early in the morning and were told that our room wouldn't be ready for another hour - we expected to have to wait most of the day. They pointed us in the direction of a nice outdoor cafe and off we went. We had a wonderful room (Room 1) right on the ground floor, and no it was not noisy in the slightest. We had a very large room, especially by European standards with a double bed and bunk beds (tasteful bunk beds not tacky) . The bathroom was very clean and well equipped with the best shower in all of Europe I'm sure. The hotel offered an indoor courtyard which is rather hot and uninviting. An outdoor courtyard would be wonderful. The cavernous breakfast room is very daunting initially but actually quite pleasant once there. The breakfast is quite hearty actually with meats, cheeses, cereals, hardboiled eggs, fresh fruit and of course coffee, tea and cappucinos (which were excellent and served with a pleasant smile) We were recommended a restaurant nearby that was amazing and we ended up eating there 2 nights in a row and would have dined there again if they weren't closed - I believe it was called Il Barbineri but please check with the hotel as it is right around the corner from them. The Trastevere area is wonderful and you really feel like you are in a medieval Italian village. We mixed with the locals and of course fellow tourist in the wonderful outdoor cafes and the hotel is only about a block from Santa Maria Trastevere Church which is lovely and the plaza in the evening is really quite an event. We were able to walk everywhere and if we were too tired we simply caught the tram or bus to wherever we needed to go, ie.. Vatican or even the Colisseum although we walked one way to both of these and it only took about 1/2 an hour. The heat is what kills you. I was a travel agent for many, many years and don't often feel overly confident giving a recommendation for a hotel unless I had a really good experience and I can honestly say that I can recommend this hotel to anyone without any qualms. One last little issue, we were told prior to arrival that the hotel had WIFI and access to a computer. We did not get either of these options. One front desk manager said that the computer was stolen , another said that it was unhooked and another didn't know where the computer was. Regarding the WIFI hookup nobody really knew why we were unable to access WIFI. So, if you are thinking of using their computer for emails home don't count on it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: NYCgirl926
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in charming Trastevere at this lovely hotel! The staff from the hotel was WONDERFUL!! I corresponded via email for booking, and received a timely and courteous response with every contact. We traveled for almost 15 hours before we reached Rome, so we were quite tired upon arriving. We were made to feel very welcome as soon as we arrived to the hotel, and it was a nice, quiet oasis to recharge before returning out to tour Rome. The staff helped with all questions regarding getting around the city, and they recommended a great, affordable restaurant for dinner which was right around the corner. The hotel was clean and very quaint. It is also in easy walking distance to most major sights. I would love to stay here again when I return to Rome, and I would recommend it to anyone. The only regret I have is that we were unable to stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a wonderful Rome neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: wcdarbonne
Reviews.Content: The Residenza Santa Maria was recommended to us by friends who stayed there two years ago. It is a wonderful hotel in the Trastevere neighborhood of Rome. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. We stayed in the "quadruple room" with a queen bed and two bunk beds. The room was very clean and quaint. The accommodations include a continental breakfast each morning, snacks at their sister hotel a couple blocks away each afternoon and free wireless internet. The hotel is walking distance for us (an active family with teenage boys) to all the major sites including the colosseum , the Vatican, the forum, etc but is in easy walking distance to ample public transportation (tram, busses, etc). The Trastevere neighborhood where the hotel is located has classic Italian narrow streets, with lots of restaurants, shops and a wonderful town square with a fountain. The staff went out of their way to make sure our stay was pleasant. One staff member even ran over to the sister hotel to get a bottle of wine, when I requested one for our room. I highly recommend the Residenza Santa Maria-I know we will be back on our next visit to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Good proximity to all the sights without feeling touristy.”
Reviews.Author: dustyscruffer
Reviews.Content: Nice spacious room for the three of us. About a 25 minute walk to Vatican, this hotel is located in old authentic Rome where there are inexpensive eateries down almost every alleyway. Front desk staff are all warm and welcoming. For the location, we found it just a bit spendy but clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: christine182
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough, it met and went beyond our expectations. We originally tried to stay at the Hotel Santa Maria (the sister property), but it was full, so we booked a room at the Residenza instead. There are so many selling points here I'm not sure I can list them all, but I'll try: super-friendly staff, immaculately clean room, charming decor, ideal location, entirely smoke-free property, *delicious* complimentary breakfast each morning, great shower, wi-fi in the room (we skyped our family daily!). Residenza guests can also enjoy aperitivo (buy a drink and eat complimentary appetizers) at Hotel Santa Maria. The room we stayed in (room 3) had an adorable little patio with a small fountain, and the size of the room was much bigger than we expected (compared to the room we had in Paris, it was huge). The air conditioner worked great... I honestly cannot think of a negative thing to say about the Residenza, or about Trastevere in general, which is a great little neighborhood. We took advantage of the Residenza's offer to book a car service that picked us up at Fiumicino airport and brought us right to the Residenza's door - a smart choice as we were dead tired on arrival and would not have wanted to go it on our own with public transport. On departure, we cabbed it to the Roma Trastevere train station and caught that train back to the airport. The best cappucinos we had in Rome were right there in the Residenza breakfast room - thank you! We cannot wait to return to the Residenza in the future, and would absolutely recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, quiet and good service”
Reviews.Author: kimoNiagara
Reviews.Content: -loved the location, service, beds, breakfast, reception, all! -only fly in the ointment was the rude and inefficient car service to the airport

Reviews.Title: “PLeasant Marathon Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Romerunner
Reviews.Content: I was in Rome to run the Marathon. The hotel was perfect for me (us); small, very nice staff, good bathroom. The location was perfect: on walking distance from the Forum Romanum and the Colosseum and in the middle of Trastevere. WE will return to this very pleasant small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you would like to find some really quiet and romantic place to stay for your holiday than I recommend you this place.”
Reviews.Author: kopon
Reviews.Content: I was in this Hotel for my holiday with my girlfriend and we enjoy there quite a lot of great thinks and one of the think which helped us with spending time was this Hotel. We enjoyed there very romantic and quiet atmosphere. Also the staff of the Hotel was very friendly. I think that the Hotel is nicely placed in a very peaceful part of Roma but it was not so far from the City Center where are the most famous places. We are very pleased that we choose this Hotel to spent our vacation. I hope that I was not there for my last time and I will be looking forward to visit this Hotel again. With many greetings Ondrej Kopecky

Reviews.Title: “If you want to live like a Roman for a few days, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: lksns
Reviews.Content: The staff is excellent, always available. We had luggage forwarded and stored without a problem. Found tours, food and fun at each request. We stayed over New Year"s and made it special. Do not miss the included internet, breakfast and "happy hour" in the comfortable communal room. Excellent bar selections at a reasonable price. Also stayed in the Spring where you can eat in the orange orchard, I am not kidding, in the middle of ROME! We were a family of five and enjoyed the loft room for five nights... In the middle of the action but QUIET!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RomeMn
Reviews.Content: Outstanding service in a hotel with charm. The staff was extremely accomadating in helping us as we toured Rome. The hotel is located within close proximity to what ever we wanted to do...eat, shop, sight see and yet out of the way of the congestion of the busy city. We enjoyed our stay and would stay there again if we were ever to visit Rome again. It is a gem!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Trastevere loved Residenza Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: PrincessRobbo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Rome several times - it's one of our favourite cities. We wanted to stay in an area that was more neighbourhood than tourist and Trastevere was an ideal choice. It's very traditional with lots of good bars and restaurants. We tried to get reservations at the Hotel Santa Maria but they were full so we were booked in to the Residenza. It was charming. We were in room one which was spacious and had a lovely bathroom. The breakfast was good and we were invited to the hotel in the early evening for drinks and nibbles. We will return to Rome of course and I can't think of anywhere else that I would rather stay than the Residenza Santa Maria.

Reviews.Title: “Splendidly Italian, peaceful, agreeable and courteous---just the right balance!"”
Reviews.Author: KirstanB
Reviews.Content: In the main flow of Santa Maria Square in Trastevere, there lies the quiet gem of the Residenza Santa Maria, sister hotel to the oasis Santa Maria Hotel. We stayed at the Residenza the first night, as our original choice was full, then moved over to the Santa Maria for the next two nights,. but we could have been happy the whole time at the Residenza...Both are 2 minutes apart, and we clattered our wheeled luggage across the Santa Maria Piazza...either choice is golden, and so fun to be amidst the bustle of the piazza, but still in a quiet sanctuary behind the hotel doors. Amazing and fully recommended! Yummy Italian breakfast with thick coffee, evening complimentary apertivo at the Santa Maria, and free bikes to use as you wish. Biking thru Rome is a real treat, although we recommend taking the small streets and pedestrian zones....much easier on the legs than WALKING everywhere...the best was the night bike ride to all the fountains and a late dinner at midnight in the Campo Di Fiori...we saw so much more in the bikes in our short 4 day stay than we could have on foot, and our legs were overly grateful to be tucked in comfy beds each night at the sister hotels...top notch restaurant recommendations from the staff, too. The Santa Marias and the Roma Pass is all you need for a great triprman--K Böttger, Hamburg Germany

Reviews.Title: “Neighborhood/Local Experience”
Reviews.Author: FlyNE1
Reviews.Content: My wife, college daughters and I stayed her for two nights on our way to a Mediterranean cruise. We found the location ideal and the local restaurants private and "local" in setting. Following the 12 day cruise, my wife and I returned to the hotel for another 3 nights before returning to the USA. Staff was very helpful and made sure all arrangements necessary for shuttle service, etc was completed. This hotel is for those who enjoy adventure and want to feel as if they are experiencing the local culture and people. You are sure to enjoy. Otolaryngologist from Texas

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: JanicePuertoRico
Reviews.Content: Do not be afraid of the area if you arrive during closing business hours. It is a very safe and lively neighborhood! During the night it is like another place with lots of restaurants and stores. The hotel Santa Maria staff will do anything for you and the rooms are very large and confortable. The breakfast was incredible!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MirDublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in late March 2008. Amazing find, reception staff (especially Robert), were so friendly. On arrival we were upgraded to a Suite, good sized room & really large bathroom. Breakfast was generous & had good selection of cold meats, cheezes etc.. When we booked they only had availability for 2 nights but as we were in Rome for 3 they got us a special deal in their bigger sister Hotel Santa Maria - again a very beautiful hotel. Trastevere is a great area to stay in, feels like your actually living among the locals, just loved the local bar down the corner & there are some great pizzerias in this area.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it here”
Reviews.Author: dianna3927
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just spent a few days in Rome and were extremely pleased with our stay at Residenza Santa Maria (I have previously stayed at Hotel Santa Maria which is equally as lovely). Located in Trastevere, it is easy to walk to key sites but also far enough away from the crazy tourist bustle. The complimentary breakfast includes fresh fruits, meats, cheeses and pastries, as well as cappucino if desired. The staff is extremely helpful and able to assist with restaurant and travel tips, and someone is at the desk and available all night. The hotel is very secure, as patrons must be buzzed in. The rooms are adorable, large, comfortable, and have excellent showers. Additionally, there is a communal computer with free internet. We truly feel our stay here was worth every Euro!

Reviews.Title: “Residenza SANTA MARIA - Welcomed us to Rome!”
Reviews.Author: tkpill
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights while in Italy. The staff was welcoming, friendly and courteous. We booked a standard room only to be upgraded to a much larger room! The location of the hotel is perfect, away from the touristy hotels, yet in the heart of Rome. I would gladly recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “ready to retreat after a busy day of here &there &everywhere,step into the residenzia, and relax!”
Reviews.Author: Miaora
Reviews.Content: After we arrived from a nightmare of a horrific airtrip to Rome, we spent the most beautiful and warm hearted time in the Residenzia Santa Maria, in Trastevere. The people to welcome you are friendly with the beauty of a rome smily face and help you along with everything you needy for! They even give the certain extra of comfort to feel home & welcomed! The breakfast is well organized, with a tremendous Caffe Latte & you are seated in a very nice athmosphere that you happy to start with in a busy city , like rome. Don´be surprised to get what you are ready for, the residenzia makes it possible. A big thank you to the Hotel, the people in front and the special person behind, they all actively take care, that you are a part of it and you feel inside! Ulrike Mayer

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: oppsikar
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome only one day and night, on our way to a week on the Amalfi Coast. The ratings of other guests convinced us to try the Residenza Santa Maria, and we were not disappointed. Trastevere is a part of Rome we had never visited or stayed in on prior trips to Rome. While we only scratched the surface, the hotel's location, amenities, and warm and friendly staff ensured we'll be back to spend more time in this Roman neighborhood, again.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel in non-touristy area of rome”
Reviews.Author: WWK
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Would stay there any chance i could get! GREAT AREA! Perfect location to get away from the crowds but also the best food in rome. Highly reccomended

Reviews.Title: “Out of the way gem”
Reviews.Author: mjus10
Reviews.Content: This place is not located in the middle of the "tourist" area of Rome but it is located amongst some of the finest restaurants in the "local" area of Rome. We were on the door step of some great places to eat at and were not ripped off as we were in the tourist part. The staff were so helpful with catering for our 19month old daughter, they even decorated the cot they provided for us with baloons to keep her entered. They have a 24 hour reception and the rooms were just perfect and quiet...which is what we needed. I would go back to this place for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Isola in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: matthiviol
Reviews.Content: The Residenza Santa Maria is a small hotel in a quiet side street, very centrally located in Trastevere. You'll find Campo di fiore or Piazza Venezia in 15 minutes walking-distance. Like all hotels in Rome never cheap, we found it somewhat disturbing, that the indoor patio in front of our room, which had barely any daylight, was used even by the personnel as a smoker's lounge. Otherwise: great stay!

Reviews.Title: “The best of the best!”
Reviews.Author: hollyv13
Reviews.Content: We traveled here at the end of winter with my husband and our children. Of all the places we stayed in Europe this was our favorite. The rooms were large and very clean. The hotel staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. They were able to inform us of many great local eateries in all price ranges. They were also able to give us clear concise directions on how to get to many of Romes attractions (as you may know, or will soon find out, Romes transportation system is confussing and unreliable). They have a breakfast buffet in the morning that was also great. The kids said of all the places we had breakfast on our 2 week trip, Residenza Santa Maria had the best! The location is also great as it is in a trendy Rome neighborhood with lots of eateries that are open very late. I highly reccomend staying here with or without children. We had a great experience and were very satisfied with the hoel, the satff and the accomodations. The location was also very good and central to everything specifically it was very close to the Colloseum, Palentine hill and many great Piazzas. On a side note, if this is your first time in Rome do not be too concerned by all the grafity in the neighborhood. I had nerver been to Rome and thought that when we arrived we must have chosen a bad neighborhood because grafity was everywhere. as I shortly realized, the entire city of Rome is covered in grafity not just Trastevere. I was there with three kids under the age of 11 and felt we were very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: harveyj9
Reviews.Content: Very nice room and friendly helpful desk staff. This is a tiny hotel, so don't expect the trappings of a large hotel. No pool, no exercise room, etc. But a good breakfast is included as is a computer in the lobby for free Internet access. With only a few rooms in the entire hotel, service seems quite personal. Liked the location -- convenient to the main tourist areas, a few blocks from the river, and public transportation, yet in a very different feeling part of Rome. Nice mix. The only downside was that the rooms are not soundproofed. We heard our "neighbors" more than we wanted or expected to. Still, we had a fine time, got good nights' sleep, and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Residenza Santa Maria: a lovely small hotel with great charm in a great city”
Reviews.Author: travel0ffen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I long ago discovered the joys of off season travel because in the world's great cities, the wonders remain throughout the year. To the traveler's advantage, one finds little or no crowds at popular spots, more relaxed atmosphere in restaurants, and lower hotel rates. That being said, Rome has wonderful boutique hotels in neighborhoods with charm, comfort and location. The Residenza Santa Maria is an outstanding example of such a place. Located in the historic Trastevere ("across the Tiber"), it's one street away from the Santa Maria church, one of Rome's oldest churches and within a great restaurant district. If you want to eat real Italian food like a real Roman, the Trastevere is the place. All the major sites are within 10 to 30 minutes away by foot. Since the Tiber has many bridges, three of them are within 10 minutes or less from the Residenza. The Residenza is the newer little sister of the lovely Hotel Santa Maria, (located a few blocks away, a street behind the other side of the Piazza Santa Maria). The Residenza has 6 very comfortable rooms with TV, phones and personal safe. All rooms are sizeable doubles, have comfortable beds, some with enough room for an additional bed if needed, large built-in closets and full bathrooms. The lobby has a 24-hour free and open laptop for internet and email. Included in the room rate is a breakfast with a full variety of croissants, sweet rolls, fruit crostini and fresh bread, fruits, cheeese, meats, yogurt, cereals, juice, milk, and hard boiled eggs. It is frankly hearty. The coffee is anyway you prefer. The bread is about the best you'll find. Fresh every morning, crunchy crust, fragrent chewy interior. I'd say downright memorable. With just 6 rooms the staff can lavish as much or as little attention on one as one wishes. Any of the typical tourist inquiries are answered with knowledge and experience. They seem to know something about every restaurant in the Trastevere (and probably the rest of Rome). The Residenza is staffed 24 hours daily, and can assist the tourist with car or taxi hire for sight seeing or to get to and from the airport or train station, know guides with or without transportation, help with ticket reservations, sightseeing suggestions, maps, etc. We were delighted to have found the Residenza and would both recommend and stay there again. Laura and Louis Offen Rockville, Maryland USA

Reviews.Title: “very nice place”
Reviews.Author: stong
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residenza Sant Maria during a couple of days in december 2008. We really enjoyed the hotel with a nicely furnished room, a nice atmoshpere and a very good breakast. The staff is very friendly and helpful with the visitors questions. Moreover the hotel is ilocated n Trastavere which is a beautiful area of Roma. A place full a charm, quiet and small enough to feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!!!”
Reviews.Author: sh192478
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent, very helpful in arranging transportation, directions, dinner recommendations, etc…. The location was great, very quiet and safe area. Breakfast was very good. Also, access to the city bus is only a few blocks away if you are looking for cheap transportation, but you have to buy the bus ticket at the corner newsstand, and then electronically swipe the bus ticket on the reader as you board. I noticed a lot of people boarding the bus that did not swipe their pass, which I guess means they received a free ride (it appears to be an honor system). In the four nights we stayed we only took the bus twice, depending on our destination we would usually walk or take a taxi. We only had few minor complaints. We did not notice any English speaking TV channels (unlike another hotel we stayed at previously) so it was hard staying in touch with the world, we did not use the TV at all as a result. We booked a room that accommodates two adults and two teenagers, but the problem was that the bathroom was very small, making it very challenging for four people to share the room. It is always a challenge sharing one bathroom with four people, but this bathroom was especially challenging because of the size and counter space. Next time if I stay again I would rather book two smaller rooms. The other minor complaint was that the small refrigerator was not always stocked, but all his is very minor. Residenza Santa Maria is a very good place to stay, I highly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “My mom and I loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ms.Howard
Reviews.Content: This was my 78 year old mother and mine favorite hotel during our 2 week visit to Italy. The room was quiet and comfortable. Hard to believe we were in noisy Rome. It was an oasis of peace and quite. The neighborhood is great like has been said by everyone else. We felt safe and secure walking the streets of this lovely neighborhood. Of course it was a quiet time of year. The weather was cold which meant none of the outdoor cafes were busy - so most nights the streets were virtually empty. The breakfast was always good - we had fresh fruit every morning. One day they even served us strawberries and this was the end of November. The only complaint and it isn't the fault of the hotel was tha the driver we hired from the airport could not find the narrow little street where the hotel was located. It wasn't even on his GPS system. We literally drove around in circles for over 30 minutes trying to find the right one way streets so that he could deliver us to the door of the hotel. He wouldn't just drop us off in the the Plazza Santa Maria. Turns out the hotel was only a block from the plazza. But he was determined to get us there himself. The best part about this hotel is the staff. Chiara at the front desk went above and beyond the call of duty for me and I will always be in her debt. I left my eyeglasses in a taxi on our second to last day in Rome. Not only did she track down the cab driver who had picked us up from the hotel but the next day she arranged to have the cab driver meet us at the Borghese Gallery to give me my glasses. I call that service. I didn't think I would like Rome but Romans like Chiara proved to me that the Romans are much nicer and friendlier than the Italians we met in other Northern Italian cities like Florence and Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Jewel in the Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: xiximullane
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about how great this hotel was. Warm and friendly staff, clean and comfortable rooms - service above and beyond. We stayed in 5 star hotels like the Rocco Forte chain in other cities and I felt more comfortable and taken care of at the Residenza. There are tons of good restaurants surrounding the hotel, so you don't have to walk far to get good food - and getting to the more touristy things is just as easy - a quick 10 minute walk and you're in Campo di Fiore. Anyone is welcome to contact me if they have questions about it - I will make it a point to stay here every time I am in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: weymann
Reviews.Content: I can recommend the hotel to all. The location was excellent for sight seeing. I would book this hotel if i come to Rome again

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: thoknight
Reviews.Content: Although the heavy rain and floods ruined our trip to Rome, we felt at home in this cosy hotel. The room was good, the breakfast could have been better. Some fresh produce would be appreciated. But all in all it was a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding hotel - can't go wrong staying here.”
Reviews.Author: Eliseok
Reviews.Content: Staff very friendly and helpful. Free internet for guests which was brilliant. Fabulous breakfast spread - best we had in the 7 weeks we were in Italy. The hotel is in a very trendy area. Lots of interesting gift shops and nice restaurants. The rooms are very lovely. Really can't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Best Quiet Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ClassicVictoria
Reviews.Content: This was the best find of our trip. The hotel was quiet and the breakfast excellent. The front desk helpful. The area was wonderful and an easy short walk across the river to the tourist sights or to the Vatican each day returning to a peaceful retreat.. All you need in terms of restaurants were just around the corner. Would stay there again. Victoria Canada

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: travelbug236
Reviews.Content: My stay at Residenza Santa Maria was by accident. I had booked with another hotel which lost my reservation. The staff did everything that they could to accomodate me and make my stay an excellent experience. They were friendly and helpful. Residenza was spotlessly clean. The atmosphere was lovely and the room was very comfortable. The breakfast was delicious and plentiful. They also had the best showerhead I had experienced in Italy! When I return to Rome, I will most definitely stay at Residenza Santa Maria again!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of charm and relaxation”
Reviews.Author: deevanj
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful! The staff is extremely courteous and helpful and made our stay so enjoyable. The rooms are extremely spacious and quiet, and amenities are great. They have a free internet hookup, a FANTASTIC breakfast, a fridge in the room and more. There is even a complimentary late afternoon snack served at a close by sister hotel. A great value in one of the most charming areas of Rome. Next time we are in Rome, we will stay at Residenza Santa Maria again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: JuhaniSalo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Residenza Santa Maria for three nights and were very content with the hotel. Room was clean and charming and the location is excellent - the city center and its sights are close but the Trastevere area itself isn't as touristy as the other side of Tevere. The breakfast was excellent and matched the description given on the website. Best of all in this place was the extremely friendly, flexible and competent service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and charming Hotel, perfect location and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: kypyGland
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in the Residenza Santa Maria very much. It's a typical little charming Hotel, very nice located in the Trastevere area where you have a huge choice of lovely italian restaurants. We had a very warm welcome and received all sorts of information about Rome. The rooms were very clean and all renovated a year ago. The breakfast in the lovely little breakfast area was very nice and you can enjoy one of the best cappuccinos of Rome! We would definitely go back to Residenza Santa Maria and will highly recommend it to all our friends and people who would like to enjoy Rome the real italian way! Thanks to the staff who made our stay a very enjoyable one. The Hafner's

Reviews.Title: “Best Neighborhood in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Rockne05
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the location of this hotel and we also loved the Residenza itself. The hotel is a small place in one of the cute little alleyways of the Trestevere neighborhood in Rome. The neighborhood is cute, eclectic, has many cafes & restaurants, and seems to be a favorite among younger locals for going out with friends. We also liked the location for walkability to central sites and for access to public transportation. The hotel is very cute and the service was great! I can only complain that we could hear our neighbors coming in and out of the hallway at night because the floors are all wood and tile, and the noise travelled well in the echo'ing environment. But, I am a light sleeper and my wife didn't hear a thing. Breakfast buffet was good and the coffee is excellent, made to order. The evening buffet at the sister hotel down the street was also a very nice touch. Internet and a computer is provided free in the lobby! Very convenient. Overall, a great experience and highly recommended for couples of any age.

Reviews.Title: “The best review from me...I would return on my next trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: dueyphipps
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Rome and I found the locale to be very convenient to transportation and many restaurants and the hotel was kept very clean, and "quaint" without the feeling of the BIG hotels. I would definitely return to this hotel. Dwight

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets!”
Reviews.Author: Solda
Reviews.Content: If you are reading this review it's probably because you're effective in organisation and planning. You are researching the internet for a hotel in Rome that has a great location, with rooms that are clean and functional. I'll make it easy for you, Residenza Santa Maria will exceed your expectations. Our accommodation requirements were for a family of four on a short mid-term break to Rome. I was familiar with Trastevere as a location and we booked directly with the hotel on that basis and the simple theory that a "Good web site equals a good product". Both proved correct. The hotel itself only has 6 rooms, and the problem with that is? The rooms are an effective size, very clean, and practically equipped for the tourist market. Don't expect to find conference rooms and gymnasiums, it's not a business hotel. The hotel is however, the epitome of a boutique hotel with high attention to detail in the design and upkeep of the interior. Friendly staff that are very relaxed and willing to help and a convenient continental breakfast with healthy and unhealthy options, accompanied by some great coffee. Trastevere is teeming with restaurants, bars, gelateria and just a great place to stroll in the evening. All major tourist attractions are within 2 km and the hotel staff will happily provide guidance for transport options but Rome is a walking city so where ever you are staying a good pair of shoes is a must. The advantage of Residenza Santa Maria is that when your walking is done for the day, everything you need in the evening is literally on you doorstep. In my opinion, Trastevere is the place to dine in Rome. It's much more affordable than across the river, a quaint atmosphere and very much the experience that most of us seek. As for cost, I look at it like this. Why spend a lot of money going to Rome and then try to save a few euros on accommodation in some noisy flea pit with indifferent staff and drunks on the street outside. Chances are you will need two rooms for a family of four in that sort of accommodation. However, the Residenza's accommodation options of suites/triples/quads will probably mean that most families have the option of one room instead of two thereby negating the additional cost of quality. If you're not still not sure about hotel options after this review, you probably never will be because this hotel really is as good as it gets. Good luck with your hunt but remember that rooms at the Residenza may already be booked anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Residenza Santa Maria is Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: mliccar
Reviews.Content: We loved the Residenzia Santa Maria. It is located in a great section of Rome, the Trastervere section. This location is close to the river and is within walking distance of many of the major sites in Rome. It is a brief walk to the Piazza Santa Maria. The Trastevere section seems to attract a very respectable group of people for dining and shopping. The hotel is located on a side street which is very quiet and peaceful even though it is very close to the bustle of the Trastevere night life. At night, the Trastevere area truly comes alive. In addition to many restaurants, bars, cafes and shops, there are various street performers and a great place to people watch. The Residenzia Santa Maria is very cozy and home-like. It is small and quaint. No formal hotel feeling here. One feels very safe and at home. The staff is excellent and hospitable. They are very professional, friendly and helpful. The rooms are very clean, comfortable and the air conditioning worked very well (something we found to be somewhat rare in Italy) for which we were especially thankful having stayed in Rome during August. We were surprised to find we had a small romantic, private patio attached to our room. The bathrooms were very clean and attractive. Our entourage of 6 included 4 younger adults (ages 16-20) who felt safe and comfortable at the hotel. We also stayed in some fine hotels in Sorrento and Cetraro, but the Residenzia Santa Maria in Rome was their favorite. We had our breakfasts there each morning which were very good and the staff kindly made us cappacinos each morning which were delicious. We would definitely return to this hotel when staying in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTractor
Reviews.Content: The Residenza Santa Maria was the perfect place to end our 3 week holiday in Italy. It is an unpretentious, beautiful little find in the back alleyway of Trastevere; the heart of Rome! I can't find one negative thing to say. The room was spacious, clean and very pretty. The staff was wonderfully friendly and helpful and the breakfast was excellent. I would recommend it to anyone..you won't be sorry!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Welcome”
Reviews.Author: mhill157
Reviews.Content: We had an unusual situation going to Rome as an adult couple with two teens and our two moms, one 86,the other 93, and both partially disabled. The staff at the Residenza was extraordinarily understanding and welcoming; found the right rooms for us; and helped us whenever we went in and out with wheelchairs and walkers. It wasn't an easy way to travel, but the Residenza made it a pleasure. I wholeheartedly recommend the place. The rooms were pleasant, clean and spacious enough, and their cappucinos at breakfast were among the best we sampled in Rome. They also accomodated my mom with breakfast in her room since she couldn't make the stairs. They made our stay so much easier.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: iluv10s
Reviews.Content: This hotel was small, quaint, and charming. The rooms were of nice size and had all the features we needed including free internet and in room safes. I am very sensitive to light and sound and found these rooms perfect for sleeping when I needed to. The beds were firm but very comfortable. The showerheads were fabulous and had great water pressure. The staff was fantastic. So polite and helpful. They spoke perfect English. We loved the Piazza Santa Maria (town square) that was right around the corner from the hotel. What a wonderful place to congregate in the evenings for food, drink, entertainment, and people watching. This was one of the highlights for our 2 teenage sons. We only stayed one evening at this hotel and quite by accident. Our original plans were to stay at the sister hotel, Hotel Santa Maria. When they were unable to accomodate us for our first evening in Rome they suggested the Residenza Santa Maria. We enjoyed it so much we tried to remain there but they were booked. We loved this hotel because it was convenient to most of the attractions yet it was off the beaten path as far as the tourists were concerned. We enjoyed this aspect because we really wanted to live like the Romans.

Reviews.Title: “Small, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Driflie
Reviews.Content: This is a delightful small hotel in a wonderful area of Rome, connected with the Hotel Santa Maria di Trastevere, where we were able to enjoy an aperitif each afternoon before dinner. Near the plaza Santa Maria, in the heart of the Trastevere district of Rome, it is convenient to restaurants, the Forum, and within walking distance of Piazza Navonna, Campo di Fiore, and other sights. Good breakfast array, rooms very comfortable, modern plumbing, free internet connection and very pleasant personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, will recommend to others. Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CrackerKiwis
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Great location clean rooms lovely helpful staff. Enjoyed breakfast which was included and also free appetisers as sister hotel around the corner which was great. Will be back here and highly recommend to others. Korrina and Glenn. New Zealand

Reviews.Title: “This stay made our Rome trip fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Travelovers8
Reviews.Content: Staying in Trastavere while in Rome was a treat we hadn't anticpated. The restaurants, the people, it felt like the real Italy that we may not have experienced had we not found the Residenza Santa Maria. The hotel was fabulous with all the modern conveniences. The staff was charming and helpful. the breakfast each morning was amazing... not just rolls and coffee, but everything you could want and made to order coffees by the wonderful attendant. We were told there were also wine and snacks in the evenings, but we never got back in time from our wanderings around the city. The bottle of wine at checkout was a particularly nice touch. We would return to the Residenza in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: eericson
Reviews.Content: The Residenza Santa Maria is an outstanding small hotel. I stayed here with my girlfriend for 3 nights and could not have been happier with the stay. Upon arrival, I realized that I had actually never actually confirmed my booking (my own fault) with the hotel. The front desk was very helpful in determining the cause of the problem and was fortunately able to arrange us accomodation in the hotel for the first night. Because the hotel was scheduled to be full for the remaining nights, the front desk called several other hotels to arrange us another place to stay for the rest of our nights in Rome. Fortunately, there was a cancellation later that day and we were able to stay in the Residenza for the remainder of our trip. Thus, I only bring up the point to emphasize the overall helpful nature of the staff. The rooms are very nicely equipped with comfortable beds and large bathrooms. Some people have issues with the small showers etc. in European hotels... not a problem here. Trastevere is the only neighborhood where I would choose to stay in Rome. The closest US equivalent I can think of would be the W. Village in NYC with a bit more of an E. Village attitude. It's perfectly convenient to the major sites (you can walk to about anywhere in Rome in 30-45 mins at most) and it is IDEALLY situated for great, fun trattorias and restaurants. Also, if you like to go out to bars and clubs, you are a 15 minute walk to Campo de Fiori, another fun night spot. My only reluctance in providing a great review is that it will make it harder to get a room for my next visit!

HotelInfo.Name: Residenza Santa Maria
HotelInfo.Address: Via Dell'Arco Di San Calisto 19/20, 00153 Rome, Italy
